entry.title: Episode 8: Rearview mirror
entry.content:
And just like that, weâ€™ve reached the end of 2024. Crazy. Itâ€™s been 1 year, but itâ€™s felt like 3!

If someone had told us 1 year ago that we would be closing 2024 with almost 20,000 active users (only 5 months after launch), we wouldâ€™ve never believed it!! We are so thankful to all the Winglers who have made this possible ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼.

Thereâ€™s still so much to do and to improve. Our goal is to make sure that whatever flight youâ€™re on, you will always find another Wingler to chat to. Itâ€™s ambitious, but weâ€™re convinced that we weâ€™ll make it with your help.

As we come to the last days of the year, weâ€™re tying up everything so Wingle can run for some days on â€œautopilotâ€ while we try to get some very needed rest. Check out whatâ€™s been happening this month:

ğŸšŒWingle is advertised on all Terravision buses in Milan and Rome taking passengers to and from the airport ğŸ¸ The â€œmake your flight betterâ€ services keep improving, with a huge offering of VIP lounges, instant compensation in case of delays, destination eventsâ€¦ ğŸ‘¨ğŸ½â€ğŸ’»Campaign in WeWork Spain locations, showcasing Wingle to their users ğŸ…ğŸ½First month of in-house content production, with a special feature and series on â€œWingleâ€™s Santaâ€; very happy with the traction ğŸŒ±Things are cooking for Jan 2025; weâ€™ll let you know what they are when they launch in the new year!

Enjoy the holiday season and have a great start to 2025 from the cockpit!

entry.title: Episode 9: Itâ€™s in the air
entry.content:
As the first (and arguably, the longest) month of the year comes to an end, weâ€™re back in the cockpit with the latest updates and general thoughts! ğŸ™Œ

While some seem to have â€œcracked the yearâ€ this first month already, with posts on â€œnew years resolutionsâ€, â€œstrategyâ€, â€œroadmaps and goalsâ€ flooding LinkedIn, we have not. ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸ ğŸ˜‰

What we do know is that for us, 2025 will be the year of growing the Wingle user base exponentially. It has to be the year of boosting brand awareness in our core markets these first few months (Spain, Italy, France) but also growing it to new countries and geographies. In 2025, Wingle will be available for all flights around the world. It will be critical to understand which markets can work best in order to focus our efforts and investment.

And how will we reach these goals? Well, weâ€™re already working on some cool campaigns for the full year, both in our core markets and new regions; ads in airplanes, PR, collabs with airlines, organic traction, social media (the big black box)â€¦

But weâ€™re not going to lie.

We donâ€™t have the crystal ball ğŸ”®. We know (and embrace) the fact that a part of what we do will be trial and error, of learning as we go, of testing, of some big hits but also of several mess-ups. But thatâ€™s how we beat all expectations for 2024. And thatâ€™s how weâ€™ll crack 2025; adapting as we go, trusting metrics and equally, trusting our gut feeling! Letâ€™s go!!!

ğŸ›« ITâ€™S IN THE AIR ğŸ›«

entry.title: Episode 7: Hustle
entry.content:
â€œYou guys are hustlers. Thatâ€™s one of the things that I like most about what youâ€™re doingâ€. This is what an investor recently told us during a call.

And honestly, we love that adjective. We often get asked what being entrepreneurs feels like, what a day in the life looks likeâ€¦ and â€œhustleâ€ might be just the word that sums it all up.

Hustle is waking up every morning and deciding who you will be cold-calling, itâ€™s building the next marketing campaign, itâ€™s shaking off your shyness and recording the next reel, itâ€™s pushing ahead with the next tech integration and app development, itâ€™s thinking about the next move that will allow you to monetize betterâ€¦.

Itâ€™s all this and itâ€™s doing it every day, even when you get rejected, when you get no answer or when the great idea doesnâ€™t quite work out right.

Weâ€™re hustlers. Itâ€™s fun, itâ€™s dynamic, itâ€™s exciting. But hustling is also extremely tiring. Today, as weâ€™re writing this, itâ€™s one of those days when energy levels are running a bit low. And this â€œCockpit Diariesâ€ felt like the right time to recognize that not every day is a sunny day and how resilience, more than genius ideas, pushes projects forward.

Check out what we were up to this month!:

ğŸ¸Welcome VIP lounge access through Wingle!

More details will follow soon, but reach out directly at hi@letswingle.com if you want to discuss directly!

So yeah, weâ€™re definitely hustling ğŸ˜‰

entry.title: Episode 6: Connecting flights
entry.content:
Hello and happy Halloween!

Whatâ€™s one of the spookiest travel situations? Picture yourself with an itinerary with several stopovers, 30 min connections andâ€¦ checked in luggage!! If everything that needs to happen works out fine, you are in for a treat. If something goes slightly wrong, then what a trickâ€¦ ğŸ˜‰

This month, weâ€™ve been building ourselves an itinerary with Wingle where there are many different moving pieces, many things to do across all fronts and lots of them where we donâ€™t know how they will turn out. But itâ€™s no fun if itâ€™s all smooth sailing, so weâ€™re in for it! Over the coming months weâ€™ll see how this itinerary turns out.

Our itinerary takes us across evolutions in the app, new partners and services, a change in our marketing and activations strategy, the first Wingle hire, lots of potential partnerships that will require a great deal of cold calling and pursuing andâ€¦ a fundraising round!

And, as every month, here are the highlights for October!

ğŸ¤We attended the World Aviation Festival in Amsterdam in early October as an invited startup. We made new connections with airlines, spoke about Wingle and unlocked new partnerships!

ğŸ§ The app has evolved to understand what moment of the travel experience youâ€™re at and offer you the best services for that step of your journey (i.e. airport lounge)

ğŸ§³Baggage storage is now available for all Wingle users

And also on several IG travel pages with +1M followers!

entry.title: Episode 5: Chicken or pasta?
entry.content:
The launch has been very successful. Itâ€™s been a huge win and something weâ€™re immensely proud of. But if we want to turn Wingle into the success we envision, this is just the tiny start.

Weâ€™ve been running like crazy and focusing all our energy the past few months on the launch and initial summer traction, but now that â€œPhase 1â€ is over, weâ€™re starting a new one where not only do we need to keep up with momentum, but increase it.

And with this new Phase comes the critical question: â€œChicken or Pasta?â€. Or in other words: Do we keep on doing what weâ€™ve been doing these past months or try something new? Seatback advertising, the â€œpastaâ€ of our user acquisition, is working very well for us and in a cost effective manner, but it is still quite an expensive channel to keep feeding every month.

So as summer comes to an end, as long trips give way to â€œweekend escapesâ€ and busy cities become the preferred destinations, itâ€™s time to try some â€œchickenâ€. And by chicken, we mean more â€œon the streetâ€ activations, promotions, guerrilla actions, competitionsâ€¦ All with the ultimate goal of continuing to build on the traction of these first 3 months and achieving longer engagement with our users.

So to the initial question: Chicken or Pasta?

Our answer: Chicken with a side of Pasta

And, as always, here are the highlights of the month!

ğŸ’ºWingle is in Iberia Express and Vueling airplanes this month! 000s of pax have met on flights to Amsterdam, Ibiza, Las Palmas, Dublin, London or Rome!

ğŸ¸lounge access, compensations in case of flight delays and new experiences are now available for all Wingle users to make the flight and travel experience more enjoyable!

ğŸ“°weâ€™re featured in Conde Nast Traveler!

ğŸ‘©â€âœˆWingleâ€™s Pilot program is out! Get rewarded for every new person that signs up to the app thanks to you! More info here:

https://tally.so/r/w24qre

ğŸ“±check out the redesigned App (released in the next couple days); everything you need, at a glance!

entry.title: Episode 4: Gear up!
entry.content:
Summers are a period to wind down, relax and disconnectâ€¦ or not. This year, our summer looks very different, as Wingle speeds up, becomes more visible and grows more and more.

With all that has been happening this month and the initial traction, we are so grateful for being able to do this, for seeing how all the hard work starts to translate into results and we are so excited for all thatâ€™s coming.

This is the summary of this first full month!

ğŸ¶get in the vibe of your destination with our music playlists; curated by BMG

ğŸ¤even before your flight, you can now meet other Winglers in person at the airport!

ğŸ—mom, dad, weâ€™re in the news!!!!

ğŸ“ºmom, dad, weâ€™re in the news (again)!!!

ğŸ’¥weâ€™re over 6.5k users!

ğŸ¤³record set at 21 people using Wingle at the same time in a flight from London to Malaga!

ğŸ’ºseatback ad campaign secured for September in an airline to be disclosed soon!

ğŸ“±evolution of both iOS and Android apps, adding features and fixing glitches; Android is picking up pace

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³somethingâ€™s cooking for Septemberâ€¦

Working across summer is not anyoneâ€™s preferred option, but when youâ€™re working on a project as exciting as Wingle, when youâ€™re building something that is yours, that you truly believe in and that you see that starts to generate traction, then work is less work. And if work can be done from different places, different settings and with the flexibility of making timings work, what else can we ask for.

And with all thisâ€¦ weâ€™ll leave you to continue sipping on your cold drink, enjoying the summer sun and Wingling on your flight back!!

Soundtrack of the month: La Gracia by The Cat Empire

On LinkedIn

entry.title: Episode 3: Takeoff!
entry.content:
Time flies!! Itâ€™s already Ep. 3 of our â€œcockpit diariesâ€ and week 3 since launch!

Monday July 1st felt as if we were pushing a big red button and screaming â€œGO!â€ After all the effort of the past 1+ yr, it was showtime!

In the weeks building up to launch week we focused on really doubling down on our content generation and social media presence together with our agency.

When weâ€™re in the viewer side, we tend to underestimate what it takes to create attractive, engaging and quality content not once, but every day of every week of every yearâ€¦ After being in the â€œcreatorâ€ side these past months, we can only say ğŸ‘ to everyone who does it for a living.

Launch week can be summarized into:

ğŸ«¨a controlled frenzy

ğŸ¤³becoming TikTokers for a day

ğŸ“ˆthe adrenaline rush of watching downloads grow

ğŸ›«obsessive tracking of every Vueling flight with ads

ğŸ‘¨â€âœˆï¸ â€œwannabeâ€ air traffic controllers

ğŸš¨sudden stress of fixing glitches

ğŸ“±frustration with pending reviews of the Android app

ğŸ’¸hype of new investors joining us

ğŸ’¡creativity spikes

ğŸ¦admiration of the British tourists in Mallorca

2 full weeks after launch and the initial feelings are very positive. The pieces are falling into place: downloads are increasing at a faster and faster pace, weâ€™re having several Winglers on every

Vueling Airlines flight with seatback ads, our user base is growing all over Europe, weâ€™re having organic interest in Wingle, weâ€™ve finally launched the Android app and we have some cool new product features to be released very soon!!

But of course, it is not all rosy. In these first weeks weâ€™ve had a first glitch (all fixed) that caused Wingleâ€™s core product, the chat, to be unavailable for several hours and weâ€™ve been battling to get the Android app released a couple weeks later than expected. On a side note, a quick request for you to update your Wingle app to the latest version ğŸ™.

All in all, weâ€™re pumped and excited. The launch has given us that extra showtime boost!

Soundtrack of the month: Pumpin Blood by NONONO

On LinkedIn

entry.title: Episode 2: Ready for takeoff
entry.content:
Welcome to Ep. 2 of â€œcockpit diariesâ€, as we get closer to Wingleâ€™s launch on July 1st.

A couple of weeks ago a friend asked: â€œhowâ€™s Wingle going?â€ and â€œwhat does the process feel like?â€. â€œIt feels like an onionâ€, was the answer ğŸ˜‚. Now, before you think what are these people talking about, hear us out:

When we began with Wingle, focus was on developing the core product; our app, and defining who we were as a brand. Over the past months, the complexity and â€œlayersâ€ of Wingle have been growing quickly. Itâ€™s no longer only about the app and the brand, but also about social media, outreach strategy, affiliate program, partnerships, integrations with suppliers, fundraising and financing, admin, PR, advertisingâ€¦ adding layer after layer to Wingle. And while it would be too much to say that some of these â€œlayersâ€ have started to run by themselves, it feels good to see how they pick up momentum.

On a personal side, it was a tense month. As the countdown to July 1st gets closer and closer, the pressure also builds up. Weâ€™re racing to have the Android app released in the coming weeks, prioritizing functionalities and use cases, pushing to get partners onboard, deciding the content and tone for social media and just generally, 100 other things in parallel. And letâ€™s be honest; we both have very different ways of looking at things. While this specifically is the â€œsecret sauceâ€ for Wingle to work, itâ€™s also sometimes a cause of dispute. While Pol is a very detail-oriented person, IÃ±igo is more of a macro-perspective guy.

But the good thing is that weâ€™re both quite vocal in sharing how we feel and have no problem in discussing and clarifying issues openly. Our â€œmakeshift therapy sessionsâ€ this past month have been great to clear the air ğŸ˜‰. At the end of the day, itâ€™s the mix of that macro and micro view of things that makes Wingle work.

ğŸš¨ In the essence of time, weâ€™ll keep the rest of the updates short:ğŸš¨

ğŸ“± Weâ€™re launching the Android version of Wingle in the next couple of weeks

ğŸ‘©â€âœˆï¸ Weâ€™ve launched an affiliate program for cabin crews, so they can promote Wingle and get rewarded for it (please share any cabin crew contacts)

ğŸ“¸ Social Media activation is live as of Monday 10th (check @lets_wingle)

ğŸ¬ We had our first Wingle â€œshootingâ€ last week, generating some very cool content (big shoutout to our friends converted into actors for a day)

ğŸ˜¤ Weâ€™ve had to scramble last minute to change our ads campaign in an airline because they considered them too â€œaggressiveâ€

ğŸ“† Wingle was at South Summit in Madrid last week and weâ€™ve been invited as startup to the World Aviation Festival in Amsterdam in October, one of the biggest global aviation fairs

ğŸ’» We have a new, simple, cleaner and more functional web

Ready for takeoff!

On LinkedIn

entry.title: Episode 1: Calibrating the radar
entry.content:
This is the first of our â€œcockpit diariesâ€; short posts where we want to keep you posted on the â€œbehind the scenesâ€ at Wingle and our learnings as we build a startup from the ground up. If you want a quick re-cap of what is Wingle and why weâ€™re launching it, read the first comment below ğŸ‘‡

This 1st episode, things â€œstarted to get realâ€; Wingle now feels like a real company. We accelerated the speed of everything, developed personality disorders from juggling all fonts of the business and realized that there are always things we had underestimated. But we also realized how sometimes, when working â€œnormalâ€ jobs, we donâ€™t unlock the full potential of our personal networks. When you jump into the â€œdeep endâ€ and are forced to be creative, you realize the power of them.

On a personal level, we felt the ups and downs, realized the importance of having a co-founder with whom to navigate the process and keep stability, and began building a work/life routine that works, gauging what feels right and what doesnâ€™t. This is still WIP by the way.

Keep reading below for what weâ€™ve been up toâ€¦

ğŸ›« The ups:

âœ…Secured advertising agreement with an European airline for summer; +160k passengers will see Wingle as soon as they board their flight

âœ…Built a super team of creatives, content creators and social media partners to drive the launch campaign

Pablo Amade

Cursiva

Alberto Miranda

âœ…Applied for certification as â€œemerging companyâ€ by ENISA

âœ…Finalizing 100k EUR investment round (last couple of tickets remaining)

âœ…iOS app is live and working; Android version is WIP for summer launch

âœ…Evolved technology using mesh networks to cover wide-body airplanes

âœ…â€œWingle Meeting Pointsâ€ concept in development (stay tuned for more ;))

âœ…Began developing a B2B value proposition. Wingle is born with a B2C aspiration, but we cannot close the door to a B2B offering

ğŸ›¬ The learnings:

ğŸ’¡ Always have a plan B. We thought we had the best team member ready to join Wingle, but it all fell apart last minute. Thankfully we had plan B in place with our external partners

ğŸ’¡ Things move painfully slow: while our decisions and responses take hours at most, many of the partners we talk to operate in slower dynamics and take long to answer (if they do at all). We need to have option 1, 2 and 3 in parallel. Option 2 is better than no option

ğŸ’¡ Block time to think: thereâ€™s so much to do, so many things to execute, that we sometimes forgot about blocking quality time to think about the product, direction and bigger picture

ğŸ’¡ Get rid of the fear of rejection. After +200 cold emails where weâ€™ve been left as â€œreadâ€ in most, the fear of rejection and (incorrect) expectation that most people will be willing to talk to you has disappeared. There is no shame in sending follow-up emails and reaching out to whoever can help; even if itâ€™s a long shot

Stay tuned for Ep.2, where weâ€™ll be almost ready for summer launch ğŸ˜‰

On LinkedIn
